name: Build filename
Build a html link to the dataset
Midnight
Next block of sensor data
Design / Implementation notes
info:
Use case:

Sometimes the earthquake tremors and aftershocks span across a 5 minute chunk so it would be useful to include a "Next" button which retrieves / plots the next 5 minute chunk of sensor data. 
That happened for the magnitude 7.2 earthquake in Mexico on 2018-02-16 23:43:00.

In the GUI, it would be easy to drop in a "Next" button between the "Retrieve / Plot Data" and "Reset" button.

The simple use case is to "add" five to the block, "15" becomes "20"
Handle edge cases 
What if minute is "55"? Increment to the next hour and minute becomes "00"
What if minute is "55" and hour is 23 ? Increment Day "09" to "10"
What if minute is "55" and hour is 23 and Day "31" (depending on the month)? Increment month 06 to 07
What if minute is "55" and hour is 23 and Day "31" and month 12?  Increment year 2019 to 2020
 
That's a crazy amount of math via strings.
 
Better approach would be to convert the strings to epoch time, add 1000 milliseconds * 60 seconds * 5 minutes, 
then convert back to the next file name.
That would handle crazy leap year edge cases too.

Just in case there is an earthquake on a leap year, Feb 28th 23:55 that spans into Feb 29 00:00 
Even in the year 2100 - the code will handle that.

name: Next Block
